subject: Ethics
title: Friedman vs Stakeholder Theory
description: Learn Friedman vs Stakeholder Theory in one minute.

hook.text: Milton Friedman said a company's only duty is to make money for shareholders. Full stop.

buildup.text: For decades, Friedman's 1970 doctrine dominated business schools: profit is the sole social responsibility.

discovery.text: Edward Freeman flipped this. Stakeholder theory says companies owe duties to employees, communities, and the planet.

twist.text: In 2019, 181 CEOs signed a statement rejecting shareholder primacy. Critics called it empty PR.

climax.text: The debate isn't settled. When profit and people clash, most boards still choose the quarterly earnings report.

punchline.text: Shareholders or stakeholders? Follow the money for the real answer.

quiz.question: What does stakeholder theory argue about corporate responsibility?
options: Companies should only maximize shareholder profit
Companies owe duties to employees, communities, and the environment
Companies should avoid making any profit
